SEARCH
Package fang2.core

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArcSprite, CompositeSprite, ImageSprite, OutlineSprite, OvalSprite, PieSprite, PolygonSprite, PolyLineSprite, PrettyStringSprite, RectangleSprite, StringSprite
public class Sprite extends Object
This class provides a structure for representing sprites which have size, shape, orientation, and color. These sprites will appear when add to the AnimationCanvas. Sprites also optionally have a tracker which will update the Sprite's properties at each time interval.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite()
      initialize to an empty shape and the default values for scale, rotation, an rotation. The Sprite must be centered around (0, 0) and width and height 1.

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(Shape shape)
      initializes to a given shape and the default values for scale and rotation. The Sprite must be centered around (0, 0) and width and height 1.
      Parameters:
      shape - the original shape of this sprite. Note: the size and location of the given shape are not stored within the Sprite. Instead they can be set once the Sprite has been constructed.

      public static Color getDefaultColor()
      gets the default color which sprites are made with
      Returns:
      the default color of the sprites

      public static Color getDefaultOutlineColor()
      gets the default color which sprites are made with
      Returns:
      the default color of the sprites

    • getNormalVector

      public static double getNormalVector(Shape stationary, Shape moving)
      Simulates the surface normal used for bouncing the moving object off of the stationary object. Normal is in the direction from the surface of the stationary object to the center of the moving shape's bounding box.
      Parameters:
      stationary - the object not in motion
      moving - the object that will bounce off of the stationary object
      Returns:
      the angle (in standard position) of the normal in radians

    • getNormalVector

      public static double getNormalVector(Sprite stationary, Sprite moving)
      Determines the surface normal between the moving and the stationary object (the moving object's normal vector is calculated)
      Parameters:
      stationary - object in motion
      moving - object not in motion
      Returns:
      the surface normal between the stationary and moving sprites

    • intersects

      public static boolean intersects(Shape one, Shape two)
      Determine if two objects implementing the Shape interface intersect. Note that this method is not cheap (it uses the Area.intersects(Area) method.
      Parameters:
      one - one of the Shapes to be tested for intersection.
      two - the other Shape to be tested for intersection
      Returns:
      returns true if the two shapes intersect, false otherwise

    • setDebugBoundingBoxColor

      public static void setDebugBoundingBoxColor(Color color)
      Set the color for all debug bounding boxes.
      Parameters:
      color - the Color with which to display any bounding boxes used for debugging

    • setDefaultColor

      public static void setDefaultColor(Color defaultColor)
      sets the default color that all sprites start with. Calling this method only affects Sprites created after calling this method.
      Parameters:
      defaultColor -

    • addTransformer

      public void addTransformer(Transformer transformerToAdd)
      Adds a TransformerNG to the collection of TransformerNGs that are attached to this Sprite.
      Parameters:
      transformerToAdd - the Transformer to add to the collection

    • applyTransformerNG

      public void applyTransformerNG()
      Called after TransfomerNG are all updated. Applies all attached transformers to this sprite. The application (the call to updateSprite) has to come from the sprite because any number of sprites might refer to a single transformer.

    • update

      public void update()
      This method is called every frame advance. It is possible to override this method to gain access to game resources such as the player mouse and keyboard.

    • copyTransformersFrom

      public void copyTransformersFrom(Sprite rhs)
      Copy rhs's transformer set to our set. The sets are then independent while individual transformers are shared by refernce.
      Parameters:
      rhs - the right-hand side in the assignment of transformers.

    • disableTransformer

      public void disableTransformer()
      Turn off all transformer/tracker objects associated with this Sprite

    • enableTransformer

      public void enableTransformer()
      Turn on all transformer/tracker objects associated with this Sprite

    • forward

      public void forward(double distance)
      Move this sprite forward according to its current facing the given distance
      Parameters:
      distance - distance, in screens, to move this thing forward.

    • getBlurLength

      public int getBlurLength()
      gets the number of sprites which are being drawn from the sprite's previous location. By default, only the sprite's current location is drawn. Setting the number to draw as greater than one can help show the path that fast moving sprites take.
      Returns:
      the number of sprites to draw in the direction of the previous location.

    • getBounds2D

      public Box2D getBounds2D()
      Get the bounding box around the Sprite in its current position. The bounding box is based on the bounding box of the value returned from the getShape() method. bcl - 20081201 - modified to return the correct bounds; had been using the Sprite's getX() and getY() method results which put the upper-left corner of the box in the center of the sprite. This is a fundamental change and should be thoroughly vetted.
      Returns:
      minimal Box2D containing all of the the bits of this Sprite

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      returns the fill color of the Sprite
      Returns:
      the fill color

    • getDashLength

      public double getDashLength()
      gets the portion of the screen each dash takes up. The return value of this method changes as the size of the sprite changes.
      Returns:
      the portion of the screen each dash takes up

    • getDashPattern

      public float[] getDashPattern()
      gets the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline. The pattern is an ordered list of on and off alternating. For example 0.2f, 0.1f, 0.4f, 0.3f means 0.2f of outline, skip 0.1f, 0.4f of outline skip 0.3f then repeat. The pattern sizes change when the size of the sprite changes.
      Returns:
      the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline

    • getDebug

      public int getDebug()
      Get the current debug setting of this Sprite.
      Returns:
      debug flag value

    • getFacingVector

      Get the vector along which we are facing.
      Returns:
      The facing vector.

      public double getHeight()

      Returns:
      height (in screens) of the sprite

    • getLocation

      public Location2D getLocation()
      the location of the shape on the canvas
      Returns:
      the location of the shape

    • getMaxX

      public double getMaxX()
      the maximum x-value covered by this Sprite; in screens
      Returns:
      maximum x-value in screens of area covered by this sprite's bounding box

      public double getMinY()
      the minimum y-value covered by this Sprite; in screens
      Returns:
      minimum y-value in screens of area covered by this sprite's bounding box

    • getOptimizedForBitmap

      public boolean getOptimizedForBitmap()
      gets whether the shape should be drawn directly to the screen or if the shape should first be drawn to an image and then the image is used to draw the shape to the screen. When the sprite is optimized for bitmaps, potentially complex shapes with curves and/or many vertexes can be simplified into a 2D array of pixels using the VolatileImage. If the shape is not complex, then it is probably just faster to draw the shape directly to the screen. By default, all Sprites are not optimized for bitmap. The decision on whether to use bitmaps or not is based upon the speed with or without using the bitmaps since the rendering will look identical.
      Returns:
      true if the shapes are flattened into pixels on a 2D image and this image should be used for drawing to screen. False indicates the shape is drawn directly to screen without first caching it into a VolatileImage.

    • getOrientation

      public double getOrientation()
      Get the current orientation of the sprite in radians. Orientation is a synonym for Rotation.
      Returns:
      rotation from initial facing in radians

    • getOrientationDegrees

      public double getOrientationDegrees()
      Get the current orientation of the sprite in degrees. Orientation is a synonym for Rotation.
      Returns:
      rotation from initial facing in degrees

    • getOrientationRadians

      public double getOrientationRadians()
      Get the current orientation of the sprite in radians. Orientation is a synonym for Rotation.
      Returns:
      rotation from initial facing in radians

    • getOrientationRevolutions

      public double getOrientationRevolutions()
      Get the number of full turns in the current rotation. Note that this returns a fractional part of the last rotation. Orientation is a synonym for Rotation.
      Returns:
      fractional number of full turns in the current rotation

    • getOutlineColor

      public Color getOutlineColor()
      returns the outline color of the Sprite
      Returns:
      the outline color

    • getOutlineThickness

      public double getOutlineThickness()
      gets the portion of the screen used in drawing the outline. Note: this method returns the width of the outline without respect to whether the outline is currently being drawn or not. Use the method isOutlineVisible to determine if the outline is currently being shown.
      Returns:
      thickness of the outline in screens

    • getRotation

      public double getRotation()
      gets the current amount of rotation in radians
      Returns:
      the positive rotation in radians less than 2*PI and zero or more

    • getRotationDegrees

      public double getRotationDegrees()
      gets the orientation of the sprite in degrees. This method calls getRotation and converts the radians into degrees.
      Returns:
      the rotation in degrees

    • getRotationRadians

      public double getRotationRadians()
      get the orientation of the sprite in radians
      Returns:
      the rotation in degrees

    • getRotationRevolutions

      public double getRotationRevolutions()
      gets the orientation of the sprite in revolutions. This method calls getRotation and converts the radians into revolutions.
      Returns:
      the rotation in revolutions

    • getScale

      public double getScale()
      the scaling factor
      Returns:
      the ratio of the current size to the orignal size of the shape

    • getShape

      public Shape getShape()
      gets the shape in its current position, size, and orientation
      Returns:
      the shape

    • getSize

      public double getSize()

    • getUseBoundingBox

      public boolean getUseBoundingBox()
      determines whether the bounding box is used for intersections of the exact shape is used
      Returns:
      true if a bounding box is being used in tests for intersection, false if the actual shape is being used

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()

    • getX

      public double getX()
      returns the x-coordinate of the sprite on the canvas
      Returns:
      x-coordinate of sprite

    • getY

      public double getY()
      returns the y-coordinate of the sprite on the canvas
      Returns:
      y-coordinate of sprite

    • hide

      public void hide()
      makes the sprite invisible. This is the same as calling setVisible(false). Sprites are visible by default. When using hide sprites continue to be affected by Trackers. removeFromCanvas is different from hide in that once removed from the canvas, sprites are no longer affected by Trackers.

    • hideOutline

      public void hideOutline()
      makes the outline not shown. By default, the outline of shapes is not drawn.

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(double x, double y)
      determines if a point is within the sprite's shape
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate of the point to test
      y - y-coordinate of the point to test
      Returns:
      true if point is in the shape, false otherwise

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Location2D point)
      determines if a point is within the sprite's shape
      Parameters:
      point - the point to test
      Returns:
      true if point is in the shape, false otherwise

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Point2D.Double point)
      determines if a point is within the sprite's shape
      Parameters:
      point - the point to test
      Returns:
      true if the point is in the shape, false otherwise

    • intersects

      public boolean intersects(Sprite sprite)
      determines if another Sprite intersects this Sprite. Intersection is a geometric property of the sprites and does not depend on whether the sprites are on the canvas or visible.
      Parameters:
      sprite - another Sprite
      Returns:
      true if the other Sprite intersects this Sprite, false if there is no intersection

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      determines the Sprite's ability to display and update
      Returns:
      true if Sprite can display and update, false otherwise

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      returns whether the Sprite is currently displayable
      Returns:
      true if Sprite can be displayed, false otherwise

    • paint

      public void paint(Graphics2D brush)
      draws the shape in the proper location, orientation, and size If overridden, this method must not add or remove sprites from the canvas. If adding or removing sprites is desired, schedule this action to occur zero seconds from now by creating an alarm which performs the desired adding or removing.
      Parameters:
      brush - the Graphics used to draw the shape

    • paintInternal

      public void paintInternal(Graphics2D brush)
      provides a mechanism for enabling and visibility. This method also handles drawing sprites in the direction of the previous location for fast moving sprites with the blur length set to greater than zero.
      Parameters:
      brush - the Graphics2D to draw on

    • removeFromCanvas

      public void removeFromCanvas()
      removes the Sprite from the canvas the next time advanceFrame is called. removeFromCanvas is different from hide (or setVisible(false)) in that once removed from the canvas, sprites are no longer affected by Trackers. When using hide (or setVisible(false)) sprites continue to be affected by Trackers.

    • removeTransformer

      public void removeTransformer(Transformer transformToEliminate)
      Remove the given Transformer from the list of transformers connected to this Sprite.
      Parameters:
      transformToEliminate - the Transformer to remove

    • rotate

      public void rotate(double rotation)
      sets the orientation with regard to the current orientation
      Parameters:
      rotation - the additional rotation in radians

    • rotateDegrees

      public void rotateDegrees(double degrees)
      sets the orientation with regard to the current orientation. This method converts the degrees to radians and calls rotate.
      Parameters:
      degrees - the additional rotation in degrees

    • rotateRadians

      public void rotateRadians(double radians)

    • rotateRevolutions

      public void rotateRevolutions(double revolutions)
      sets the orientation with regard to the current orientation. This method converts the revolutions to radians and calls rotate. One revolution is the same as 360 degrees or 2*PI radians.
      Parameters:
      revolutions - the additional rotation in revolution

    • scale

      public void scale(double scale)
      scale with regard to the current scaling. The resulting scale will be the product of the current scale and the scale parameter.
      Parameters:
      scale - the factor by which to change the current scale, must be nonzero

    • setBlurLength

      public void setBlurLength(int length)
      adds a sequence of translucent sprites from the sprite's previous location to the current location in increasing opacity. By default, only the sprite's current location is drawn. Setting the number to draw as greater than one can help show the path that fast moving sprites take.
      Parameters:
      length - how many sprites to draw from the previous position

    • setColor

      public void setColor(Color c)
      determines the fill color of the shape. All shapes are filled by default and the default color of the fill is blue.
      Parameters:
      c - the fill color

    • setDashLength

      public void setDashLength(double length)
      sets the length of the dashes used in drawing the outline. This length changes when the size of the sprite changes.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of each dash as a portion of the screen

    • setDashPattern

      public void setDashPattern(float... dashes)
      sets the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline. The pattern is an ordered list of on and off alternating. For example 0.2f, 0.1f, 0.4f, 0.3f means 0.2f of outline, skip 0.1f, 0.4f of outline skip 0.3f then repeat. The pattern sizes change when the size of the sprite changes.
      Parameters:
      dashes - the on/off pattern of the dashes used in drawing the outline

    • setDebug

      public void setDebug(int i)
      Set the debug flag for this Sprite to the given value. Currently defined values for this flag (which can be |'ed together) are: Sprite. DEBUG_BOUNDING_BOX - draw bounding boxes around the sprite every frame from now on. DEBUG_INTERSECTS - dump debug data to stderr during collision detection tests.
      Parameters:
      i - New value for the debug flag.

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean able)
      sets the Sprite's ability to display and update
      Parameters:
      able - true indicates the Sprite can display and update, false otherwise

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(double x, double y)
      sets the location without regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      x - the horizontal location (in screens)
      y - the vertical location (in screens)

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(Location2D location)
      sets the location without regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      location - the sprite's new location (in screens)

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(Point2D.Double location)
      sets the location without regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      location - the new location

    • setOptimizedForBitmap

      public void setOptimizedForBitmap(boolean enableBitmap)
      Note: this method is current disabled. If the method is desired, email the author of the FANG Engine to request it be added back in. sets whether the shape should be drawn directly to the screen or if the shape should first be drawn to an image and then the image is used to draw the shape to the screen. When the sprite is optimized for bitmaps, potentially complex shapes with curves and/or many vertexes can be simplified into a 2D array of pixels using the VolatileImage. If the shape is not complex, then it is probably just faster to draw the shape directly to the screen. By default, all Sprites are not optimized for bitmap. The decision on whether to use bitmaps or not is based upon the speed with or without using the bitmaps since the rendering will look identical.
      Parameters:
      enableBitmap - true indicates the shapes should be flattened into pixels on a 2D image and this image should be used for drawing to screen. False indicates the shape should be drawn directly to screen without first caching it into a VolatileImage.

    • setOrientation

      public void setOrientation(double radians)
      set the rotation of this Sprite without regard to its current rotation.
      Parameters:
      radians - new rotation value in CCW radians away from the positive x-axis

    • setOrientationDegrees

      public void setOrientationDegrees(double degrees)
      set the rotation of this Sprite without regard to its current rotation.
      Parameters:
      degrees - new rotation value in CCW degrees from the positive x axis

    • setOrientationRadians

      public void setOrientationRadians(double radians)
      set the rotation of this Sprite without regard to its current rotation.
      Parameters:
      radians - new rotation value in CCW radians away from the positive x-axis

    • setOrientationRevolutions

      public void setOrientationRevolutions(double revolutions)
      set the rotation of this Sprite without regard to its current rotation.
      Parameters:
      revolutions - new rotation value in CCW revolutions (full circle = 1.0) away from the positive x-axis

    • setOutlineColor

      public void setOutlineColor(Color c)
      determines the outline color of the shape. By default the outline is white and not visible. In order to see the outline, call showOutline.
      Parameters:
      c - the outline color

    • setOutlineThickness

      public void setOutlineThickness(double thickness)
      sets the portion of the screen that the outline should fill. The outline of the shape is drawn around the edges of the shape and is always in the internal part of the shape.
      Parameters:
      thickness - the width of the outline as a portion of the screen

    • setOutlineVisible

      public void setOutlineVisible(boolean visible)
      this is a helper method that either calls showOutline or hideOutline
      Parameters:
      visible - true means call showOutline, false means call hideOutline

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double rotation)
      sets the orientation without regard to the current orientation
      Parameters:
      rotation - the new orientation in radians counter-clockwise for the original orientation

    • setRotationDegrees

      public void setRotationDegrees(double degrees)
      sets the orientation without regard to the current orientation. This method converts the degrees to radians and calls setRotation.
      Parameters:
      degrees - the new orientation in degrees from the original orientation

    • setRotationRadians

      public void setRotationRadians(double radians)
      sets the orientation without regard to the current orientation. The method uses radians directly.
      Parameters:
      radians - the new orientation in radians counter clockwise from the original orientation

    • setRotationRevolutions

      public void setRotationRevolutions(double revolutions)
      sets the orientation without regard to the current orientation. This method converts the revolutions to radians and calls setRotation. One revolution is the same as 360 degrees or 2*PI radians.
      Parameters:
      revolutions - the new orientation in revolutions from the original orientation

    • setScale

      public void setScale(double scale)
      sets the absolute scale without regard to its current value, must be nonzero. If zero is sent in as the parameter, a very small number will be used instead.
      Parameters:
      scale - the new scale

    • setSize

      public void setSize(double size)

    • setUseBoundingBox

      public void setUseBoundingBox(boolean box)
      Sets the parameter which determines if the actual shape or its minimal bounding box is used in tests for intersection. Using exact intersection is the default.
      Parameters:
      box - true indicates a bounding box should be used, false indicates the actual shape should be used

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(boolean vis)
      sets if the Sprite will be displayed when added to an AnimationCanvas. Calling setVisible(true) is the same as calling show(). Calling setVisible(false) is the same as calling hide(). When using hide sprites continue to be affected by Trackers. removeFromCanvas is different from hide in that once removed from the canvas, sprites are no longer affected by Trackers.
      Parameters:
      vis - true indicates to display, false to hide

    • setX

      public void setX(double newX)
      sets the location's x-coordinate without regard to the current location. y-coordinate is unchanged
      Parameters:
      newX - - new x-coordinate

    • setY

      public void setY(double newY)
      sets the location's y-coordinate without regard to the current location. x-coordinate is unchanged
      Parameters:
      newY - - new y-coordinate

    • show

      public void show()
      makes the sprite visible if it is on the canvas. Sprites are visible by default.

    • showOutline

      public void showOutline()
      makes the outline of the shape appear around the edges of the shape. Note: this method does not change the overall shape - instead it makes visible the edges by painting a line around them. If this is the first time the method is called, the thickness of the outline will be set to a default value. This outline thickness will change as the size of the sprite changes.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return a string representation of the Sprite. The type, location, size, and color of the Sprite.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • translate

      public void translate(double x, double y)
      moves the shape with regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      x - the amount to move horizontally location
      y - the amount to move vertically location

    • translate

      public void translate(Location2D delta)
      Moves the shape with regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      delta - the directional info for the move

    • translate

      public void translate(Point2D.Double delta)
      moves the shape with regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      delta - the amount and direction to move the shape from its current location

    • translate

      public void translate(Vector2D deltaV)
      Moves the shape with regard to its current location
      Parameters:
      deltaV - the vector along which to move.

    • translateX

      public void translateX(double deltaX)
      moves sprite horizontally relative to current location
      Parameters:
      deltaX - - amount to move horizontally

    • translateY

      public void translateY(double deltaY)
      moves sprite vertically relative to current location
      Parameters:
      deltaY - - amount to move vertically

    • drawDebugShapes

      protected void drawDebugShapes(Graphics2D brush)
      Draw debug shapes. This method draws the bounding box.
      Parameters:
      brush - The graphics context in which to draw the box

    • getTransformers

      protected List<Transformer> getTransformers()
      Return the list of transformers.
      Returns:
      the list of all of the transformers currently on this sprite. Reference is live.

    • isDestroyed

      protected boolean isDestroyed()
      determines if the sprite should be removed from the AnimationCanvas
      Returns:
      true if Sprite should be removed, false otherwise

    • normalize

      protected void normalize()
      resizes to be 1 by 1 and centers around origin (0, 0)

    • paintShape

      protected void paintShape(Graphics2D brush)

    • setAbsoluteShape

      protected void setAbsoluteShape(Shape s)
      sets shape to shape s and uses the location and size information. Calling this method affects the scale and location of the sprite. The new size is the maximum dimension of the shape and the new location is the center of the shape.
      Parameters:
      s - the new shape of the sprite

    • setDebugBrush

      protected void setDebugBrush(Color brushColor, Graphics2D brush)
      Sets the drawing context's brush to be a thin brush with the given color; this method is provided so that Sprite subclasses can easily set up to paint debugging information.
      Parameters:
      brushColor -
      brush -

    • setShape

      protected void setShape(Shape s)
      sets shape to shape s. Calling this method has no effect on the scale, location, or orientation of the sprite
      Parameters:
      s - the new shape of the sprite

    • reportTransformers

      public void reportTransformers(Set<Transformer> allTransformers)
      Add all Transformer associated with this sprite to the allTransformers set.
      Parameters:
      allTransformers - the set of all transformers; provided by the caller.
